column4: this might be a strange question, but did anyone manage to read the PS3 HDD in ubuntu?
i think they call it IFS, (by IBM), trying to confirm...
ifs never heard of it. ext3 would be easy
do you want to repartition it?
u may use gparted to find out about the filesystem type
but it won't mount it for you afaik
how big is it in total?
the size is right, but 'unallocated' is wrong i guess
use fdisk -l  maybe it will tell you more
it could also use a partition table that even fdisk won't understand. in that case you need to google
